title: 403b Group Enrollment
html:
Home » Services » Retirement » 403b for Groups » 403b Group Enrollment

AGFinancial 403(b) Group Enrollment

What’s one gotta do to get AGFinancial 403(b)?

You’re in luck. We guide you through the process in these super simple easy-to-follow steps.

Complete these four steps to enroll.

Confirm Eligibility

The following individuals can participate in the AGFinancial 403(b) Retirement Plan:

1. An Assemblies of God credentialed minister who is self-employed within the meaning of Internal Revenue Code 414(e)(5)(A)(i)(I). Example: An evangelist would qualify.

2. Assemblies of God credentialed ministers who provide services to any other organization unrelated to the Assemblies of God to the extent that the services are in connection of ministry (example: a chaplain).
The employer may make contributions on behalf of the minister or the minister may make contributions to the plan directly.

3. Employees of eligible employers.

An eligible employer is:

– An Assemblies of God church
– The General Council of the Assemblies of God
– A District Council of the Assemblies of God
– Any other organization that is controlled by or associated with the Assemblies of God which is tax-exempt under 501(c)(3)* of the Internal Revenue Code.


*501(c)(3) organization. Corporations, and any community chest, fund, or foundation, organized and operated exclusively for religious, charitable, scientific, testing for public safety, literary, or educational purposes, or to foster national or international amateur sports competition (but only if no part of its activities involve the provision of athletic facilities or equipment), or for the prevention of cruelty to children or animals, no part of the net earnings of which inures to the benefit of any private shareholder or individual, no substantial part of the activities of which is carrying on propaganda, or otherwise attempting, to influence legislation (except as otherwise provided in subsection (h)), and which does not participate in, or intervene in (including the publishing or distributing of statements), any political campaign on behalf of (or in opposition to) any candidate for public office.

Complete Enrollment Form

Prior to opening your 403(b) account, review the Plan document

Download Plan Summary
Download Form

Customize Your Plan

Choose one of the Agreements below to define eligibility, benefits, and compensation for your ministry employees. Completion of the appropriate Agreement will establish your ministry’s 403(b) plan.

  • Agreement 1: Your ministry is a church or QCCO.
  • Agreement 2: Your ministry is a NQCCO

Note: QCCO = Qualified Church-Controlled Organization. NQCCO = Nonqualified Church-Controlled Organization. See full list of 403(b) Terms & Definitions for details.

The Service Agreement, which is included in the written plan forms above, is used to identify the roles and responsibilities of the employer and AGFinancial. Without the Agreement, the employer is solely responsible for compliance for all 403(b) administrative and regulatory issues. Additionally, with our exclusive written plan and Agreement, we will be responsible for administration of hardship distributions and plan loans.

If you have questions or need additional information, please reach out. Our team is here to help.

This information and the information contained in links are not considered legal or tax advice. AGFinancial is available to give guidance and assistance to your ministry and your ministry’s legal and tax professionals. Check with your own advisors to ensure you have satisfied all the IRS 403(b) regulation requirements.

Return Enrollment Form

To submit securely online, click here.

Complete Payroll Deduction Agreement Form

Complete the Payroll Deduction Agreement Form to request, from your employer, pre-tax salary reduction contributions to your 403(b) account or after-tax Roth 403(b) contributions. Keep a copy of the Payroll Deduction Agreement Form for your records and send the original form to your employer.

Download Form

403(b) COMPLIANCE REGULATIONS

The Internal Revenue Service issued regulations on 403(b) plans that generally became effective on January 1, 2009. These regulations impact all 403(b) plans and are comprehensive on the governance of such plans. The regulations require, among other things, a written plan document that contains the material plan provisions. The consequences of not meeting the regulations can be severe. The penalty for failure to comply may include, but is not limited to, immediate taxation of each participant’s balance. If AGFinancial is your exclusive service provider, your compliance implementation can be easy. NOTE: Compliance may be more complex if using multiple providers.

403(b) Guidelines of Administrative Responsibilities

AGFinancial and MBA provide multiple administrative functions for compliance with regulations; however, some administrative functions are your responsibility as the employer (fiduciary). Download a listing of primary responsibilities based on your organization type. The checklists are provided as a convenience and should not be returned to us or the IRS.

Download Qualified Church-Controlled Organizations (QCCO) Guidelines

Download Nonqualified Church-Controlled Organization (NQCCO) Guidelines

For assistance, contact us at 800.622.7526 or email us at 403bregs@agfinancial.org.
